acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48-hour EC50=4.0mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 1998).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since there were data of 5560mg/kg (RTECS (2004)) of a rabbit, it was set as outside of Category. The data (RTECS (2004)) of the guinea pig was not adopted by the guideline.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Since the value of >290ppm (RTECS) was over saturated vapor concentrations, it was considered to be mist. It is thought that it is category 4 or category 5 since this value is equivalent to 1.78mg/L, but the LC50 value which becomes a decisive factors is not acquired.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Since median lethal is not reached at the saturated vapor concentration at normal temperature of 20degC with 80ppm, and 30 degC with 196ppm, LC50 level is not acquired.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Although there were two data of 2.7g/kg  (ACGIH (2001)) and 320 mg/kg (RTECS (2004)) in rat LD50, the lower one was adopted and it was set as Category 4.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since there is no test reports and there is also no classification evaluation of the institution, it cannot classify.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 2, since acute toxicity was Category 2 and not rapidly degrading (BOD: 0% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though less bio-accumulative (BCF=50 (existing chemical safety inspections data)).

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Not classified because of its flash point: >93degC and liquid

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of experimental data

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: The data on sensitizing was not found.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: It was set as "Category 1"since skin corrosivenesses was Category 1C and intense stimulus was also reported with the eye of a rabbit (ACGIH (2001)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: As for animal, there is a result of severe burn with exposure for 24 hours (ACGIH (2001), RTECS (2004)), and burn is reported with occupational exposure (ACGIH (2001)), it was classified as "Category 1C".

skin_sensitizer.rationale: The data on sensitizing was not found.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since there are not a study reports and a report of occupation exposure influence, it cannot be classified.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: It is classified into "Category 3 (respiratory irritation)" by that which has statement of the respiratory irritation about humans (ACGIH (2001)).
